dmTitle.techName: H2 REFUELING GROUNDING - RESISTANCE TEST 3 MILLIOHM

levelledPara.title: GENERAL
levelledPara.para: This procedure verifies the grounding system resistance for the H2 refueling system. Maximum allowable resistance is 3 milliohm (0.003 Ω) to ensure effective static discharge protection. This test is required monthly and before every refueling operation. Supported by CAOS Real-Time Decision tree model RTD-02-32-GROUND-v1.0.yaml.

listItem.para: Digital milliohm meter P/N 02-32-90-METER-001 (±0.1 milliohm accuracy)

proceduralStep.para: Don safety glasses.
Locate aircraft grounding point. Location: Forward fuselage, station 180, below refueling panel. Marked with yellow triangle and "GROUND" label.
Visually inspect grounding point for:
If any defects found, clean or repair before proceeding.
If grounding point shows contamination:
Clean contact surface with brass wire brush.
Apply contact cleaner.
Wipe dry with clean, lint-free cloth.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Do NOT use steel wire brush. May cause galvanic corrosion. Use ONLY brass or bronze brush.

proceduralStep.para: Configure milliohm meter for 4-wire (Kelvin) measurement.
Zero the meter with test leads shorted together.
Verify zero reading: 0.0 ± 0.1 milliohm.
Connect meter test leads:

listItem.para: RED current lead to aircraft grounding point
RED voltage sense lead to aircraft grounding point (close to current lead)
BLACK current lead to aircraft structure (bare metal, minimum 2 meters from grounding point)
BLACK voltage sense lead to aircraft structure (close to current lead)

proceduralStep.para: Ensure good electrical contact at all connection points.
Scrape through paint or anodizing if necessary to reach bare metal.
Take resistance measurement.
Wait for reading to stabilize (typically 2-3 seconds).
Record reading in maintenance log.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Resistance must be ≤ 3.0 milliohm (0.003 Ω).
Take three measurements at different angles around grounding point (0°, 120°, 240°).
Record all three readings.
Calculate average resistance.
Average must be ≤ 3.0 milliohm.
Maximum reading must be ≤ 3.5 milliohm.
If resistance > 3.0 milliohm:

listItem.para: Inspect bonding strap for corrosion or damage
If still > 3.0 milliohm, refer to troubleshooting TS-02-32-07

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do NOT perform H2 refueling if grounding resistance > 3.0 milliohm. Static discharge protection is inadequate. Risk of ignition.

proceduralStep.para: TEST BONDING JUMPERS (if applicable)
Aircraft has 4 bonding jumpers connecting major fuel system components:

listItem.para: Jumper 1: Refueling receptacle to fuselage structure
Jumper 2: Main refueling valve to fuel tank
Jumper 3: Fuel line support clamp to structure
Jumper 4: Leak detection sensor panel to structure

proceduralStep.para: For each bonding jumper:
Connect milliohm meter across jumper (component to structure).
Measure resistance.
Record reading.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Each jumper resistance must be ≤ 2.0 milliohm.
If any jumper resistance > 2.0 milliohm:
Inspect jumper for:

listItem.para: Paint or anodizing at contact points

proceduralStep.para: Clean, tighten, or replace jumper as required per procedure 02-32-90-40-001.
GROUND CABLE CONNECTION TEST (during refueling setup)
This test is performed when ground refueling equipment is connected.
Connect ground cable from refueling truck to aircraft grounding point.
Verify ground cable lug is clean and tight.
Torque ground cable lug to 25 ± 3 Nm.
Measure resistance from aircraft grounding point to ground equipment frame.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Total circuit resistance (aircraft + cable + equipment) must be ≤ 10 milliohm.
If total resistance > 10 milliohm:

listItem.para: Verify ground equipment frame is properly grounded

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do NOT proceed with refueling if ground circuit resistance > 10 milliohm.

proceduralStep.para: Disconnect milliohm meter test leads.
Complete maintenance record entry with:

listItem.para: Milliohm meter serial number and calibration due date
Aircraft grounding point resistance (3 readings + average)

proceduralStep.para: If monthly test PASSED, apply or update test sticker at grounding point:
"GROUND RESISTANCE TEST - [DATE] - [VALUE] mΩ - NEXT DUE [DATE]"
Update CAOS database with test results.
System tracks resistance trends and predicts when maintenance will be needed.
